Degemer mat !

I’m a P.h.D student under the supervision of Nicolas Courty, Laetitia Chapel an Romain Tavenard within the OBELIX team of IRISA in Vannes.

I graduated from École Centrale de Lille with major in data science and now working on Optimal Transport. More precisely my objective is to include the inherent structural information of usual machine learning objects (graph, time series…) in the Optimal Transportation problem and to use this new formulation for the classification of structured data.

Accepted Papers

  • Sliced Gromov-Wasserstein. NeurIPS 2019
  • Optimal Transport for structured data with application on graphs. ICML 2019

Preprints

  • CO-Optimal Transport: available on ArXiV
  • Time Series Alignment with Global Invariances: available on ArXiV
  • Fused Gromov-Wasserstein distance for structured objects: theoretical foundations and mathematical properties: available on ArXiV

Talks

  • March 2019 : I was invited at Qarma in Aix-Marseille University to talked about “Optimal Transport for Structured data”. Slides
  • Juin 2018 : “Fused Gromov Wasserstein Distance” at CAp Conference

Teaching :

  • Ecole Centrale de Nantes (ECN) October 2019 : Towards more Deep Learning (GAN’s, Wasserstein GAN’s, VAE, Fine-Tuning), all materials available here
  • Ecole Centrale de Nantes (ECN) October 2018 : Generative models (GAN’s, Wasserstein GAN’s and VAE), all materials available here
